User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

I've set "Berylium" as a font-face in the body style attribute:

<body style="font-family:Berylium">

and had some text ("This is a bolded paragraph.") surrounded in bold (<b>) tags. 

Test page: http://kekkai.org/camomiletea/Request1316570.html


Actual results:

The bolded paragraph is displayed in italics and shifted alphabetically by one letter/symbol, like this:

"Uijt jt b cpmefe qbsbhsbqi/"

Note that even the period (.) gets shifted (/). When I select the text and copy it to somewhere else, it is copied correctly ("This is a bolded paragraph."). Internet Explorer and Safari display this correctly (i.e. bolded and not shifted alphabetically); Google Chrome and Opera display it both in bold and italics (although not quite as much italics as a normal italic paragraph), but it's not shifted alphabetically. 


Expected results:

It should display "This is a bold paragraph." in bold.
